name: Sir
short_description: Do you frequently install programs and libraries from source and want an easy way to keep track of these installations? The source installation record, sir, is a simple shell script which manages anything installed from source with the standard autoconf setup. Simply run 'sir' in the toplevel directory of the source tree after install, and it will find and store information on the package. Later, you can use sir to uninstall the package if need be using the original Makefile saved by sir, or you can look up information such as version and configuration flags.
